snippet: Congress and the White House are supporting a terrible package of bills that would undo essential investor protections.
abstract: Editorial criticizes both Congress and the Obama administration for supporting a terrible package of bills that would undo essential investor protections; asserts that despite claims that overly burdensome regulations have impeded the ability of small businesses to grow, given that the financial system almost imploded in 2008, there is no excuse for relaxing regulations.
lead_paragraph: Congress and the White House are supporting a terrible package of bills that would undo essential investor protections.

headline.seo: Washington Has a Very Short Memory

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
